div.span: SB County Public Health News Releases

span.a: March 18, 2020 - Two new cases of novel coronavirus recorded within county
March 17, 2020 - County orders cancellation of all gatherings; Third case confirmed
March 16, 2020 -Second case of novel coronavirus recorded within county
March 15, 2020 - First case of novel coronavirus recorded within county
March 13, 2020 - Health Officer orders cancellation of large gatherings; no local cases in County
March 12, 2020 - County orders cancellation of large gatherings
March 11, 2020 - County declares local health emergency; Still no cases in the County
March 10, 2020 - Health Officer Order - Mandated COVID-19 Reporting
March 9, 2020 - County Continues to Monitor COVID-19; reports no local cases
March 5. 2020 - Governor Declares State of Emergency, County reports no local cases
March 2, 2020 - County continues to monitor COVID-19; reports no local cases

span.data-emptytext: Yucaipa-Calimesa Joint Unified School District provides equal opportunity in its programs, activities, and employment
span.data-value:
Contact us at: contact_us@ycjusd.us

The Governing Board desires to provide a safe school environment that allows all students equal access and opportunities in the district's academic and other educational support programs, services, and activities. The Board prohibits, at any district school or school activity, unlawful discrimination, harassment, intimidation, and bullying of any student based on the student's actual race, color, ancestry, national origin, ethnic group identification, age, religion, marital or parental status, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, or gender expression; the perception of one or more of such characteristics; or association with a person or group with one or more of these actual or perceived characteristics.

This website is regularly reviewed and updated to ensure compliance with Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act and Title II of the Americans with Disabilities Act. Any website accessibility concerns or suggestions may be brought to the attention of ​Mark Pierson at ​mark_pierson@ycjusd.us

p.span:
Contact us at: contact_us@ycjusd.us
The Governing Board desires to provide a safe school environment that allows all students equal access and opportunities in the district's academic and other educational support programs, services, and activities. The Board prohibits, at any district school or school activity, unlawful discrimination, harassment, intimidation, and bullying of any student based on the student's actual race, color, ancestry, national origin, ethnic group identification, age, religion, marital or parental status, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, or gender expression; the perception of one or more of such characteristics; or association with a person or group with one or more of these actual or perceived characteristics.
This website is regularly reviewed and updated to ensure compliance with Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act and Title II of the Americans with Disabilities Act. Any website accessibility concerns or suggestions may be brought to the attention of ​Mark Pierson at ​mark_pierson@ycjusd.us

p.a: Website Hosting Solution Powered by SchoolBlocks

div.h3:
Welcome to the SchoolBlocks
self-guided tour!
div.p: The most common question we receive is, how is SchoolBlocks inspired by Pinterest? SchoolBlocks eliminates navigation bars and uses a block style layout that’s similar to Pinterest. It creates a unique and engaging browsing experience, optimizes for mobile and removes a lot of navigational complexity.
Please click on the red plus signs found on this page to learn more about specific features.
